answers.answer: Programs such as the Mental Health Support Program and the Crisis Intervention Team provide mental health support for refugees from Ukraine.
answers.bResponse: Programs such as the Mental Health Support Program and the Crisis Intervention Team provide mental health support for refugees from Ukraine. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees

answers.answer: Refugees who meet specific criteria set by the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and local authorities may be eligible to receive mental health services. The UNHCR works with partner organizations to provide support for those in need.

The UNHCR works with partner organizations to provide support for those in need. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/psychological-support-for-ukrainian-refugees

answers.answer: The workshops organized by ALIAT Association focus on discussing the trauma of war and its impact on well-being and mental health. They are conducted in Ukrainian and Russian languages. The workshops take place every Wednesday at the Aliat Clinic (Ioan Cuza Boulevard, 5A), and Fridays at the Sante Clinic. To sign up, please contact the organizers via the email address inside@aliatong.ro.

answers.answer: The target audience for these workshops are Ukrainian adults who wish to openly discuss the trauma of war and its impact on their well-being and mental health. The workshops are organized by the ALIAT Association, which takes place every Wednesday at the Aliat Clinic (Ioan Cuza Boulevard, 5A) and Fridays at the Sante Clinic. To sign up, one can contact the team at the email address inside@aliatong.ro.
